alert.note: Alert for Dauphin; Juniata; Northumberland; Perry; Snyder (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 4:31PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN NORTHUMBERLAND... NORTHWESTERN DAUPHIN...NORTHEASTERN JUNIATA...SOUTHEASTERN SNYDER AND NORTHEASTERN PERRY COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM EDT... At 431 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles southwest of Selinsgrove, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Millersburg, Elizabethville, Port Trevorton, Richfield, Mount Pleasant Mills, New Buffalo, Meiserville, Liverpool, Halifax, Dalmatia, Berrysburg and Pillow. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
